every row and the piece is worked back and forth to make the front of the piece shorter after the raglan increases are complete stitches are divided for the body and arms and decreases are made at the back to prevent gaping fabric at the back body ribbing is worked in the round over back stitches and stitches from the stitch holder at the front arms are worked in the round with decreases to create a snug fit around the arm and finished with ribbing pattern instructions neck/yoke cast on 70 sts on 5mm circular needles using the long tail method or another stretchy cast on method join in the
